name: Woodstock Inn, Station & Brewery

reviews.text: The Inn is such a fun place to walk around. They have a brewery tour that is fun. The food is good. The lounge has music and good drinks. The rooms clean and airy. The bathroom was a nice size. We stay at the birch. The white mountains has so much to do. We went zip lining and on a moose tour and saw 7 moose.
reviews.title: Has it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will return again. Loved it
reviews.title: Great Place!!

reviews.text: We have visited this restaurant twice in the past month for dinner. On July 25 we had dinner there after a 6 mile day hike in the White Mts. This is a large restaurant with several rooms, but we like the dining room closest to the Main Street as it is cozy and quieter. The service is always excellent and the food is nicely prepared. This place has the best burger in NH. Ground beef from a local farm that is fantastic. They also have a micro brewery with nice seasonal selections. You won't go wrong here, but arrive there early as it gets very busy after 5:30pm.
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on the brewery tour and also had lunch. I'd rate the brewery tour much higher than lunch.
reviews.title: Nice Room...But, Quite Noisy
Great lunch, great brew and great service
reviews.text: The tour was given by one of the brewmasters, who was knowledgeable and animated, and she took us into the brewery to see behind the scenes. The beer is ok -- IMO, it's not as complex as I'd like, but it's enjoyable and the tour is a good deal for the money. $5 gets you a tour, which lasts 30-45 minutes, and includes a tasting of three beers at the end. Totally worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a second visit, albeit 21 years later than when we had greatly enjoyed a stay in this small town. This time we booked a room (Haystack) in the main building for 3 nights but the en-suite apart it was a poor room. Dark and dingy decorated in a chintzy style over twenty years ago judging by the loss of colour in the elaborate and peeling wallpaper. The air conditioning, essential all night it was so warm, was noisy. At least there was fridge in the room. The chairs and sofa were placed such that it was pointless to watch TV from them, better to just sit on the bed and view.
reviews.title: A mistake to go back

reviews.text: We breakfasted here each morning and the cook's efforts were enough to suggest that it wouldn't be a great experience dining in the restaurant at night. Service was provided in a very brusque manner on 2 of the 3 mornings.
reviews.title: There were more flies than customers.

reviews.text: The outside patio is nicely located on the main street and the tables there are busy most the time. A couple of times we ate simple fare there, burgers etc. and they were OK. Service quality was mixed, OK from a lady on the first day but excruciating from some lummox on the second day who thought he was the bees knees, the type that tries to ingratiate themselves for a good tip but gets the order wrong and then blames the kitchen. On the third night we ate in the next town, nice meal too with great service.
reviews.title: Best Bar/Restaurant in Area

reviews.text: If you're offered a gift of a growler of beer (4 US pints) on arriving, beware. You can't drink it with a meal, you can't drink it at the bar in fact you can't drink anywhere on the premises except in your room. New Hampshire law apparently. We gave our bottle back as we're not very given to swigging pints of beer in the bedroom! That said, the beers that we bought with our meals were pretty good even if they were served in plastic beakers.
reviews.title: Enjoyed dinner at the brewery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Woodstock Inn has invested heavily in the next door brewery and bar facilities and these are very popular. The downside is a very obvious loss of attention to the hotel side of the business.
reviews.title: Stayed here for weekend Skiing. We'll be back!

reviews.text: My husband are big micro brew fans and this is by far our favorite place to drink, eat and stay. All of the food is awesome and at a very reasonable price! I highly recommend the brewery tour if you're into beer... You won't be disappointed!! We always look forward to going back! The inn is very quaint and affordable. It's also rumored to have the best breakfast in the area which is included in your overnight stay! Give it a try I promise you won't be disappointed!!!
reviews.title: Great place overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went here after a day of hiking in Franconia Notch. It's a perfect stop after a long day hiking because it's right off I-93 heading south from the Whites. We sat at the bar and had good service. They have great beers - I'd tried them from the supermarket before and have a good options.
reviews.title: Great Beer, Food, and Quality Veggie and Gluten Free Options

reviews.text: They had a large menu and what I loved about our experience is that they actually had really good veggie options. Many brewpubs will have a freezer of veggie patties for the occasional vegetarian, but they had a wide selection. I had an amazing grilled portobello open faced sandwich. Even my meat-loving boyfriend said "Wow! That looks so good". Although I'm not Gluten Free, I noticed that they had a whole gluten free menu.
reviews.title: Renovation looks great! But needs more staff.
Food OK, Service Poor
reviews.text: We will definitely be going back to Woodstock Station!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't spend the night there so I can't comment about the overnight accomodations.
reviews.title: Quaint and clean!

reviews.text: Staff was rude when we called to confirm reservations and ask for directions. Then we ate dinner at the hotel's restaurant. Never got our dinner rolls/ bread, very slow service, rarely saw our waitress.
reviews.title: Staff needs attitude adjustment.
Horrible, rude!
reviews.text: Were told to ask for ice at the front desk...no one was there so the waitress called out for a young man to come from a back room. They proceeded to argue in front of us about who should get the ice!

reviews.title: Great burgers!
reviews.text: The rooms were nice enough and clean but the locks on the door didn't work.
This was very disappointing since we returned there because we enjoyed it so much last year...The manager was apologetic and gave us some of the rootbeer made there....
reviews.title: Slow and no guidance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to dinner got a coffee that taste like it has been sitting since last week! Service was slow as usual! And are waiter charlie was very very rude!!! Never again an with the food prices not worth it!
reviews.title: Great lunch!

description: New Hampshire’s favorite for food, fun and relaxation. 33 rooms in five historic buildings, many with Jacuzzis and fireplaces. Two restaurants: The Clement Room Grill is an upscale bistro and the Woodstock Station, which received a Hidden Gem award from The Phantom Gourmet. is lively and casual. Brewpub, lounge, entertainment, Beer Garden, free access to nearby in door pool and spa. River swimming, Minutes to all White Mountain Attractions, Loon and other Ski Areas
